document.masterDocTitle: The Yponomeutidae of the Afrotropical region (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Yponomeutidae of the Afrotropical region (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea)

bibRefCitation.author: Zeller, P. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Zeller, P. C. (1852) Lepidoptera Microlepidoptera quae J. A. Wahlberg in Caffrorum terrae collegit. Kongliga Vetenskapsakademiens Handlingar, 1852, 1 - 120.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Type locality: Republic of South Africa : Kwazulu Natal

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription of adult ( Plate 3 ). Wingspan 16–30 mm . Head white, labial palpus black but white around intersegmental joints; scape white becoming black distally, flagellum white for first five flagellomeres, then blackish with faint annulation. Thorax white with two black spots and black at anterior and posterior extremes; tegula white, marked black on the front. Forewing white with 5 rows of black spots, the spots tending to be elongated in a transverse direction, especially those near the dorsum; terminal fringe white. Hindwing grey, fringe paler. Abdomen grey, legs black but white on each joint. Specimens from Yemen are smaller ( 16–20mm ) and their genitalia are proportionately smaller too.

Diagnosis. The species is distinguished by the conspicuous spots being elongated in a direction across each forewing and in the male genitalia the small spine on the edge of the valva can be seen without dissection.

Biology. The species has been reared from
Gymnospora senegalensis , Maytenus heterophylla , Maytenus arbutifolia
and
Maytenus
fruits.
Distribution. Republic of South Africa , Swaziland , Mozambique , Zimbabwe , Zambia , Malawi , Tanzania , Rwanda , Kenya , Uganda , Ethiopia , Yemen , Madagascar .

Taxonomic note. DNA barcodes indicate that this species comprises two or three taxa (in Kenya Taita and Rift Valley BOLD:ABY3728, BOLD:AAE0418, and in South Africa BOLD:ACE4424 about 1.48% divergent with the latter BIN, the former BIN around 5.18-5.62% divergent from the last two), but morphological or biological differences have not been detected.

Type material.
Holotype ♂ Swedish Museum of Natural History , Stockholm (not examined). REPUBLIC OF SOUTH AFRICA
: Lectotype ♀ of perficitella , Pt Natal 55.96; Paralectotype without abdomen, same data (NH- MUK).
Holotype ♂ of
Trisophista pauli Viette
( MNHNP ) (examined including genitalia slide)
.
